@Sub20hz

If you are using Windows Media Player you will need a external audio switcher, like haali media splitter. if you are using VLC you would 

1.right click when your mouse is hoovering over the picture.

2. Select Audio

3. Audio Track

3. Track 2 [English]


but tbh, I would say download mkvtoolnix, then drag the movie into the "Input" Area, 

Then "Uncheck" the "A_AC3". Should be the first audio file and the second one down from the top.
of you still can't find it, then if you select one of the audio codecs and look at the bottom of the window and it says [Default Track flag -Yes] then remove that one and leave the other. I will try to check up on this page again to see if you got it

if your TV has a 3D options setting then I am almost positive that in the options you can reverse them from the plain TV options settings. On my Samsung it is labeled L/R Change. but if your TV Doesn't have it then I would not give any kudos to your TV manufacturer. But I doubt it is not in your 3D options menu. Try messing with it a bit without screwing up your settings.
